FuncDef:
The set port-queue weight-mode command sets the WFQ queue scheduling mode of an interface to Weight.
The undo set port-queue weight-mode command restores the default WFQ queue scheduling mode of an interface.
By default, the WFQ queue scheduling mode of an interface is CIR.
Examples: Warning: After config, the interface will change to default configuration of current mode. Please select[Y/N]:y
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The WFQ queue scheduling mode of an interface can be set to Weight or CIR. To set the WFQ queue scheduling mode of an interface to Weight, run the set port-queue weight-mode command.
Configuration Impact
After the command is executed, all configurations of the original mode are cleared, and the default value of the current mode is restored.
After this command is executed, you can run the port-queue wfq weight command to configure WFQ scheduling parameters, including the weight and shaping rate, for an outbound port queue on an interface.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the following subcards:
2-Port Channelized STM-1c POS-SFP Flexible Card (P50)4-Port Channelized STM-1c POS-SFP Flexible Card (P50)8-Port Channelized STM-1c POS-SFP Flexible Card (P50)
